| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       | [EvilHack - monst.c, line 1548](https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/master/src/monst.c#L1548) |

The **fell beast**, D, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") and [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"). It is a [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"), [thick-skinned](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned") and [dragon](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon")-like [carnivore](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore") that acts as the steed of [Nazguls](/wiki/Nazgul "Nazgul") - it is capable of [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight"), can [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible") and has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").

A fell beast has two claw attacks and a bite attack.

## Generation

Fell beasts are not randomly generated, and are always created hostile.

A randomly generated Nazgul will have a fell beast serving as their steed.

## Encyclopedia entry

It was a winged creature: if bird, then greater than all other  
birds, and it was naked, and neither quill nor feather did it  
bear, and its vast pinions were as webs of hide between horned  
fingers; and it stank. A creature of an older world maybe it was...  
\[ J.R.R. Tolkien, The Return of the King,  
"The Battle of the Pelennor Fields" ]

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Fell_beast\&action=edit)*

html:
Fell beast

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
D fell beast
Difficulty 16
Attacks Claw 4d5, Claw 4d5, Bite 2d6
D fell beast
Difficulty 16
Attacks

Claw 4d5, Claw 4d5, Bite 2d6

Base level 14
Base experience 363
Speed 12
Base AC -2
Base MR 20
Alignment -17 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1200
Nutritional value 800
Size Large
Resistances cold,sleep,poison
Resistances conveyed None

A fell beast:

  • can fly.
  • has no hands.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • has infravision.
Reference EvilHack - monst.c, line 1548

The fell beast, D, is a type of monster that appears in SpliceHack and EvilHack. It is a strong, thick-skinned and dragon-like carnivore that acts as the steed of Nazguls - it is capable of flight, can see invisible and has infravision.

A fell beast has two claw attacks and a bite attack.

Generation

Fell beasts are not randomly generated, and are always created hostile.

A randomly generated Nazgul will have a fell beast serving as their steed.

Encyclopedia entry

It was a winged creature: if bird, then greater than all other
birds, and it was naked, and neither quill nor feather did it
bear, and its vast pinions were as webs of hide between horned
fingers; and it stank. A creature of an older world maybe it was...
[ J.R.R. Tolkien, The Return of the King,
"The Battle of the Pelennor Fields" ]

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

The '''fell beast''', {{magenta|D}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[SpliceHack]] and [[EvilHack]]. It is a [[strong]], [[thick-skinned]] and [[dragon]]-like [[carnivore]] that acts as the steed of [[Nazgul]]s - it is capable of [[flight]], can [[see invisible]] and has [[infravision]]. 

A fell beast has two claw attacks and a bite attack.

==Generation==
Fell beasts are not randomly generated, and are always created hostile.

A randomly generated Nazgul will have a fell beast serving as their steed.

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|
	It was a winged creature: if bird, then greater than all other
	birds, and it was naked, and neither quill nor feather did it
	bear, and its vast pinions were as webs of hide between horned
	fingers; and it stank.  A creature of an older world maybe it was...
	   [ J.R.R. Tolkien, The Return of the King,
		"The Battle of the Pelennor Fields" ]
}}
